values.text: üëã Welcome to FlightSavvy! I can help you find the best time to book flights for the lowest prices. How can I assist you today?
Hello! I'm your FlightSavvy assistant. I can help you find the best time to book flights, compare airlines, check baggage policies, and more. How can I help you today?
<? entities.city && entities.city.length >= 2 ? 'I see you want to find flight prices from ' + entities.city[0].value + ' to ' + entities.city[1].value + '. When are you planning to travel?' : '' ?>
<? entities.city && entities.city.length == 1 ? 'I see you want to find flights from ' + entities.city[0].value + '. Where would you like to fly to?' : '' ?>
<? !(entities.city && entities.city.length) ? 'I can help you find the best time to book a flight. To get started, where are you flying from?' : '' ?>
<? @city ? 'Great! You are flying from ' + @city + '. Where would you like to fly to?' : '' ?>
<? !@city ? 'I need to know where you are departing from. For example, New York or Chicago.' : '' ?>
<? @city ? 'Flying from ' + $origin + ' to ' + @city + '. When are you planning to travel? For example, June or December to January.' : '' ?>
<? !@city ? 'Please tell me your destination city.' : '' ?>

<? @month.length > 0 ? 'Great! You plan to travel' + (@month.length > 1 ? ' from ' + @month[0] + ' to ' + @month[1] : ' in ' + @month[0]) + '. Do you have any preferred airlines? If not, just say "no preference".' : '' ?>
<? !(@month.length > 0) ? 'When are you thinking of traveling? You can tell me specific months like "June" or a period like "June to August".' : '' ?>
<? @airline ? 'Got it! Looking at ' + @airline + ' specifically. Are you traveling as an adult, child, or student? Student status might qualify you for additional discounts.' : '' ?>
<? !@airline ? 'Are you traveling as an adult, child, or student? Student status might qualify you for additional discounts.' : '' ?>

<? @passenger_type ? 'Great! I see you are traveling as a ' + @passenger_type + '. What level of price analysis would you prefer: monthly, quarterly, weekly, or daily? Monthly is our standard recommendation.' : '' ?>
<? !@passenger_type ? 'What level of price analysis would you prefer: monthly, quarterly, weekly, or daily? Monthly is our standard recommendation.' : '' ?>
Thanks for all the information! I'm now analyzing flight prices for $origin to $destination during $start_month<? $start_month != $end_month ? ' to ' + $end_month : '' ?>...
One moment while I search for the best flight deals...

‚úÖ Flight Price Analysis: $origin to $destination

‚úàÔ∏è Best time to book: $prediction_result.formatted_best_time

üí∞ Expected fare: $<? $prediction_result.best_time.predicted_fare.toFixed(2) ?>

<? $carrier ? 'üè¢ Airline: ' + ($prediction_result.carrier_name || $carrier) + '

' : '' ?><? $passenger_type == 'student'? 'üéì Note: Students may qualify for additional 10-15% discounts

' : '' ?>Recommendations:
‚Ä¢ Book during this period for optimal prices
‚Ä¢ Consider mid-week departures for additional savings
‚Ä¢ Flexible dates can save you 10-15% more
<? $carrier == 'Southwest' ? '‚Ä¢ Take advantage of Southwest\'s free checked bag policy
' : '' ?><? $carrier == 'Spirit' || $carrier == 'Frontier' ? '‚Ä¢ Remember to factor in baggage fees when comparing prices
' : '' ?>
Would you like to analyze another route?
I'm sorry, but I couldn't get price predictions for that route. This may be due to limited data for the $origin to $destination route. Would you like to try a different route?

Here's some information about airlines:

‚Ä¢ Budget carriers like Spirit, Frontier, and Allegiant typically offer the lowest base fares but charge for extras
‚Ä¢ Southwest offers 2 free checked bags, making it economical for travelers with luggage
‚Ä¢ Delta, American, and United are full-service carriers with more amenities and broader route networks
‚Ä¢ JetBlue offers more legroom in standard economy than other US carriers
‚Ä¢ Alaska Airlines consistently ranks high for customer satisfaction

<? @airline ? 'Looking for specific information about ' + @airline + '?' : 'Would you like to know about a specific airline?' ?>

<? @airline == 'American' ? 'American Airlines (AA) is one of the largest airlines in the world. They operate a hub-and-spoke network with major hubs in Dallas/Fort Worth, Charlotte, Chicago, Miami, and others. They charge $30 for the first checked bag on domestic flights. Their frequent flyer program is AAdvantage.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Delta' ? 'Delta Air Lines (DL) is known for operational reliability and customer service. Their hubs include Atlanta, Detroit, Minneapolis, and Salt Lake City. Delta charges $30 for the first checked bag on most domestic flights. Their frequent flyer program is SkyMiles, which never expires.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Southwest' ? 'Southwest Airlines (WN) is unique with their open seating policy (no assigned seats) and generous baggage allowance (2 free checked bags). They do not charge change fees. Southwest operates a point-to-point network rather than a traditional hub-and-spoke system. Their frequent flyer program is Rapid Rewards.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'United' ? 'United Airlines (UA) is one of the major US carriers with hubs in Chicago, Denver, Houston, and others. They charge $30-$35 for the first checked bag on domestic flights. Their frequent flyer program is MileagePlus. United has a large international network through the Star Alliance.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'JetBlue' ? 'JetBlue (B6) is known for offering more legroom than other US airlines in standard economy. They have free in-flight WiFi and entertainment. JetBlue charges $35 for the first checked bag for most fares. Their frequent flyer program is TrueBlue. Their main hub is in New York (JFK).' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Spirit' ? 'Spirit Airlines (NK) is an ultra-low-cost carrier that offers very low base fares but charges for nearly everything extra, including carry-on bags, seat assignments, and even water. They have one of the tightest seat pitches in the industry. Their frequent flyer program is Free Spirit.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Frontier' ? 'Frontier Airlines (F9) is a low-cost carrier with low base fares and fees for extras like baggage and seat selection. Their aircraft feature animals on the tail and they focus on environmental efficiency. Their frequent flyer program is Frontier Miles. Their main hub is in Denver.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Alaska' ? 'Alaska Airlines (AS) consistently ranks high in customer satisfaction. They have a strong presence on the West Coast with hubs in Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, and Los Angeles. They charge $30 for the first checked bag. Their frequent flyer program is Mileage Plan, which partners with many international airlines.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Allegiant' ? 'Allegiant Air (G4) is an ultra-low-cost carrier focusing on leisure travel markets. They often fly from small airports to vacation destinations with limited frequency (not daily service). They charge for all baggage including carry-ons, seat assignments, and other extras.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Sun Country' ? 'Sun Country Airlines (SY) is a low-cost carrier based in Minneapolis. They focus on flying to leisure destinations, particularly in warm weather locations. Like other budget airlines, they charge for baggage and seat selection. Their frequent flyer program is called Sun Country Rewards.' : '' ?>
<? !@airline ? 'Is there a particular airline you would like to know more about?' : '' ?>

Here's a quick guide to baggage policies for major US airlines:

‚Ä¢ Southwest: Best baggage policy with 2 free checked bags (up to 50 lbs each)
‚Ä¢ Most major airlines (American, Delta, United): First checked bag costs $30-35, second bag $40-45
‚Ä¢ Budget carriers (Spirit, Frontier, Allegiant): Charge for all bags including carry-on ($35-65 depending on when you pay)
‚Ä¢ JetBlue: First checked bag $35, Blue Plus and Mint fares include checked bags
‚Ä¢ Overweight bags (over 50 lbs): Additional $100-200 fee on most airlines

<? @airline ? 'Would you like specific baggage information for ' + @airline + '?' : 'Do you need information for a specific airline?' ?>

<? @airline == 'American' ? 'American Airlines Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Carry-on: 1 free personal item + 1 carry-on bag
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $30 (domestic), often waived with their credit card or elite status
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $40 (domestic)
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 50 lbs per bag
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches (length + width + height)
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (51-70 lbs): $100 additional' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Delta' ? 'Delta Air Lines Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Carry-on: 1 free personal item + 1 carry-on bag
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $30 (domestic), often waived with their credit card or elite status
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $40 (domestic)
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 50 lbs per bag
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (51-70 lbs): $100 additional' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Southwest' ? 'Southwest Airlines Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Carry-on: 1 free personal item + 1 carry-on bag
‚Ä¢ First and second checked bags: FREE (up to 50 lbs each)
‚Ä¢ Third bag and beyond: $75 each
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 50 lbs per bag
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (51-100 lbs): $75 additional

This is the most generous baggage policy among major US airlines.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'United' ? 'United Airlines Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Carry-on: 1 free personal item + 1 carry-on bag
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $35 (domestic), often waived with their credit card or elite status
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $45 (domestic)
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 50 lbs per bag
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (51-70 lbs): $100 additional' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'JetBlue' ? 'JetBlue Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Carry-on: 1 free personal item + 1 carry-on bag
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $35 (free with Blue Plus, Mint, or Mosaic status)
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $45
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 50 lbs per bag
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (51-99 lbs): $150 additional' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Spirit' ? 'Spirit Airlines Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Personal item only is free (must fit under seat)
‚Ä¢ Carry-on bag: $37-65 (cheaper when purchased in advance)
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $32-65 (cheaper when purchased in advance)
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $42-75
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 40 lbs per bag (stricter than most airlines)
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (41-50 lbs): $30 additional

Prices vary based on when you purchase (booking, before check-in, at check-in, or at gate).' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Frontier' ? 'Frontier Airlines Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Personal item only is free (must fit under seat)
‚Ä¢ Carry-on bag: $39-60 (cheaper when purchased in advance)
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $34-55 (cheaper when purchased in advance)
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $45-60
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 50 lbs per bag
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (51-100 lbs): $75 additional

Prices vary based on when you purchase and route.' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Alaska' ? 'Alaska Airlines Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Carry-on: 1 free personal item + 1 carry-on bag
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $30 (often waived with their credit card or elite status)
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $40
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 50 lbs per bag
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (51-100 lbs): $100 additional' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Allegiant' ? 'Allegiant Air Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Personal item only is free (must fit under seat)
‚Ä¢ Carry-on bag: $20-35 (varies by route, cheaper online)
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $25-35 (varies by route, cheaper online)
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $35-45
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 40 lbs per bag (stricter than most airlines)
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (41-70 lbs): $50 additional' : '' ?>

<? @airline == 'Sun Country' ? 'Sun Country Airlines Baggage Policy:
‚Ä¢ Carry-on: 1 free personal item, carry-on bag costs $30-40
‚Ä¢ First checked bag: $30-40 (cheaper when purchased in advance)
‚Ä¢ Second checked bag: $40-50
‚Ä¢ Weight limit: 50 lbs per bag
‚Ä¢ Size limits: 62 linear inches total
‚Ä¢ Overweight fee (51-79 lbs): $50 additional' : '' ?>
<? !@airline ? 'Would you like baggage information for a specific airline?' : '' ?>

Yes, students can save on airfare! Here's what you should know:

‚Ä¢ Dedicated student travel sites like StudentUniverse and STA Travel offer verified student discounts (10-30% off)
‚Ä¢ Some airlines offer student fares but require valid .edu email or student ID
‚Ä¢ Student discounts are more common for international flights than domestic
‚Ä¢ Best student deals are typically found on:  
   - Lufthansa, Air France (European carriers)  
   - United, American (for international routes)
‚Ä¢ Student discount sites may offer special deals during spring and winter breaks

To get the best student deals, always check both the airline's website and student discount platforms.

Flight prices follow predictable seasonal patterns:

‚Ä¢ January (Post-holiday): Generally lower prices, good deals available
‚Ä¢ February-March: Moderate prices except during Spring Break weeks
‚Ä¢ April-May: Shoulder season with reasonable fares
‚Ä¢ June-August: Peak summer season with highest prices
‚Ä¢ September-October: Another good shoulder season
‚Ä¢ November-December: High prices around Thanksgiving and Christmas, but deals available between holidays

Destination matters too: Caribbean is expensive in winter, Europe peaks in summer, and Hawaii commands premium prices year-round.

<? @season ? 'For ' + @season + ' travel specifically, ' + (@season == 'Summer' ? 'book as early as possible (3-4 months ahead) as summer is peak season with consistently high prices.' : @season == 'Winter' ? 'book holiday travel (Christmas/New Year) at least 3 months in advance, but January/February (except Valentine\'s Day) offer better deals.' : @season == 'Spring' ? 'avoid Spring Break weeks in March/April for best prices. early May can offer excellent value.' : 'consider early October for best deals as November prices increase for Thanksgiving.') : '' ?>

FlightSavvy uses advanced machine learning to predict optimal booking times:

‚Ä¢ Our system analyzes historical flight pricing data across millions of routes
‚Ä¢ We identify patterns based on factors like season, day of week, holidays, and carrier
‚Ä¢ Predictions incorporate airline pricing strategies and market competition
‚Ä¢ The system accounts for route-specific trends (e.g., vacation destinations have different patterns)
‚Ä¢ Machine learning models continuously improve as they process more data

For your specific route, we analyze multiple timeframes to identify when prices historically dip and recommend the optimal booking window based on your travel dates and airline preferences.
Let's start fresh! What would you like to know about flight prices?

I can help you with:

‚Ä¢ Finding the best time to book flights based on your travel plans
‚Ä¢ Providing information about specific airlines and their policies
‚Ä¢ Explaining baggage policies and fees
‚Ä¢ Sharing student discount opportunities for air travel
‚Ä¢ Offering insights into seasonal pricing trends
‚Ä¢ Explaining how our flight price predictions work

To get started with flight price predictions, simply tell me something like "When is the best time to fly from New York to Miami?" or "I need to find cheap flights to Chicago in June."
Thanks for using FlightSavvy! Have a great trip, and come back when you're planning your next adventure. Safe travels! ‚úàÔ∏è
Would you like to search for another route or get information about a different aspect of air travel?

I didn't quite understand. I can help you find the best time to book flights, provide information about airlines, or explain baggage policies. Try asking something like "When should I book my flight from Chicago to Miami?" or type "help" for more options.

description: A travel assistant chatbot that helps users find the best time to book flights
name: FlightSavvy-Chatbot
